headline: Mongolian Beef and Spring Onions
description: This Mongolian beef recipe features crispy slices of flank steak with a sweet soy-based sauce and green onions for a restaurant-quality dish at home!

video.description: Spicy, sweet, and savory beef can do no wrong for a dinner meal!
video.name: Mongolian Beef and Spring Onions

name: Mongolian Beef and Spring Onions
recipeIngredient: 1 pound beef flank steak, sliced 1/4 inch thick on the diagonal
2 bunches green onions, cut in 2-inch lengths

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in brown sugar, soy sauce, and water. Increase heat to medium-high; stir until sauce boils and slightly thickens, about 4 minutes. Remove sauce from the heat and set aside.
Place beef into a large bowl; add cornstarch and mix until beef is thoroughly coated. Set aside until most of the cornstarch has been absorbed, about 10 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Shake excess cornstarch from beef slices and drop into hot oil, a few at a time, stirring briefly and frying until edges become crisp, about 2 minutes. Remove beef with a large slotted spoon; drain on paper towels.

Remove excess oil from the skillet, then heat the skillet over medium heat; add beef slices and stir in prepared sauce. Add green onions and bring to a boil; cook until the onions have just softened and are bright green, about 1 to 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Tastes amazing, first meal I’ve ever made and it was simple and delicious

A very easy and tasty meal. As another review stated I also used powdered ginger and a sweet white onion cut into chunks. Very delicious. My grocery store sells stir fry beef and made the recipe even easier.
Great stuff. It's a go to for us when we can find sandwich steak on sale or clearance. It's a great go to when your able to find rice, plus, not have to pay for the nose for it all. great stuff.

Wonderful basic recipe to make. I had to add a few substitutes, as I didn't want to go to the store for a couple things. I use powder ginger instead of fresh, did not have any green onions in the bin so used a half large sweet yellow onion. I also added a few more shredded veggies, carrots, celery and home grown green beans. Everything was great as far as the amounts of ingredients. I will make it again when I have the green onions and fresh ginger. Oh, I forgot that I tossed in 5 dried home grown peppers, for heat. Husband loved it.
Just too sweet. I prefer my favorite take-out restaurant version. This couldn't hold a mirror to it.
I added a lil more brown sugar but that’s personal preference
Delicious!
Tasty sauce and the meat was very tender. Served with sauteed brussel sprouts and wild rice.

I've made this a few times now and my wife just loves it -- the kids aren't sold but will eat rice with just about anything. I've made it with flank, strip, and top sirloin. All those were workable choices. I use a slightly different method of browning the meat off in the wok before building the sauce, which works for me better, but the recipe method makes sense, too. I've made broccoli with it every time so far - roasted with garlic once, steamed once, and blanched with romaine and served with garlic sauce once. Very satisfying meal, every time.
Excellent. I think I wold add a little more water. The sauce was quite strong, but delicious!
Made this the other night, it was delicious. The only thing was the sauce didn't thicken the way it should have, I will add some more cornstarch the next time.
I wasn’t into the beef but the sauce was amazing and so easy to make. Using the sauce in chicken stir fry tonight
Love this recipe. One thing I would change is the soy sauce, I suggest going for a low sodium soy sauce instead. I added broccoli and bell peppers also.
Delicious!

DELICOUS!! I didn't have dark brown sugar, so i used light brown it came out perfect ! I used 6 packs of ramen noodles without the seasoning. i also cooked a batch of perfect potstickers. It fed my family of 5 that has 3boys (2 teens) without adjusting the recipe.

OMG my family absolutely loves this dish this is the third time I made it and this time I had to double it it's that good. This time I added about a tablespoon of crushed red pepper flakes because my boys like stuff spicy and it is absolutely fantastic can't recommend it enough
This recipe has way too much sugar in it. If I were to make again, would only use no more than 1/4 cup or less. We could hardly eat it. Too bad because we love this dish normally.

I can only give this four stars because it has way more sugar than I would use. I cut it down to a couple tablespoons and the result was delicious. So otherwise a very good recipe and a big hit with my kids.
Everyone loved it! Next time, I will add more soy sauce and less brown sugar. I will also cut the onions into 1/2 inch pieces.

This was fantastic! A great flavor slightly sweet and sticky. Just a couple of hints. The first is use a small top round London broil and save yourself a about $3 a pound or more. The second is slice the meat slightly defrosted. Yes, freeze the meat and slice once the knife can cut through the center safely. This will allow thinner more uniform thicknesses of the slices. The third hint is to double the sauce Everyone will want to add the sauce to the rice liberally since it is so good. The only issue was the mess it made frying the meat on my stove but it was well worth it. Enjoy
Excellent!
Delightful and better than take out! Prep everything before you start cooking.
Great recipe

This turned out really well! I increased the amount of meat and it left me with a great meat:sauce ratio! This could definitely be substituted with any type of steak (I’ll do this in the future, as this type of steak is quite pricey where I am). This was a great recipe overall and it’s well worth trying.

It was very good. I added extra vegetables, like broccoli and mushrooms. I had never cooked flank steak before, and would have marinated it longer prior to cooking the dish. But it tasted just like what I would get at a Chinese restaurant.
Tasted just like Panda Express
Made this recipe exact. Was so good. Next time I will add some red pepper to give it a lil kick.
This was pretty good though I am not sure I made it well. I served it over noodles.
Followed the recipe exactly and loved the results! Close replica to PF Chang’s! I will absolutely make again!
Family loved it.

Delicious! I've been trying different dishes for quick weeknight meals. This will be added to my official rotation. My husband (who is Chinese) gobbled this up. It's definitely an Americanized dish but it is so good! Similar to something you'd get at a takeout place. 

Make sure you have all ingredients ready to go before you start cooking, because once you do it goes fast!
This is delicious! I did reduce the brown sugar to a 1/4 cup and used the healthier avocado oil to cook the meat.
Wow, it's like eating meat in syrup! I'm sure lots of people love it but it's way too sweet for me!

I have made this dish multiple times since my husband and I crave it. The only thing I do differently is to add mushrooms (cut in 1/2 inch chunks), carrots (cut julienne style) and use a pound or so of New York strip steak cut thin. I serve it over rice but usually season the rice with a little lime juice and green onions (the green part). This is an amazing recipe and I make this at least twice a month.
Really yummy the only modification I made was about 1/3 toasted sesame oil in my vegetable oil… Yum To take me about twice as long to make it though took me about an hour.

We absolutely love this dish. That being said, sauce is everything. We added chunky sweet onions, pieces of green pepper, snap peas...I need more vegetables typically. But at the end of the week when the fridge is getting bare, this is better than takeout.
Easy to make. One of my faves for caribou meat as well.
Thanks for sharing. It was a bit too sweet for me. Next time I will cut down the sugar.

This was by far the best meat I have ever made. I would suggest doubling the sauce as we just wanted more of it. It also took longer to make than I thought , so next time I would cut the meat the day before . You could even cook the meat ahead of time as it was even better heated up the second day. Served over rice this was super good.
Wonderful
Very good! Like other reviewers said, might reduce the sugar, since it is a bit sweet. I also added broccoli and some yellow onion. I’ll make this again for sure

Amazing. I did use light brown sugar and powdered ginger. Still tasted fine. I also added splash rice wine vinegar. I actually did not think it tasted too sweet or too salty so some people had comments about that but I did not notice extremities in flavor. I also added red pepper flakes.

I added yellow onion, mushrooms, and green peppers. Also, I substituted flank steak for sliced beef tenderloin. Turned out great, though the soy sauce flavour was perhaps a little too strong. It could be because I didn't have any ginger.
Absolutely excellent!! Would def make again!
Pretty good. My husband really loved it, but it was just ok for me. Not sure what was missing, maybe just not my thing... I will make this for him again maybe with a little rice as well.
Absolutely delicious. Adjust sugar to your own taste. 5 stars as is though. Yum

Absolutely fantastic! I didn't have flank steak so used thinly sliced sirloin. Also used dried chives in place of the spring onions. Sauce was out of this world! Going to try using thinly sliced chicken breast next time.
I absolutely loved it, even my son who hates beef had some and loved it, will definitely be making on a regular basis
I actually followed the recommendations but I made it with pork ribs in the slow cooker. My kids could not stop eating
Great recipe! Our family thought it a bit salty and needs a lot more green onion scapes.

I cooked this recipe and it came out excellent! The whole family loved it! I served this delicious food with cooked white rice! 
I only made few changes with the recipe. I add 1 teaspoon of ginger instead of half. I put 3 tablespoons of brown sugar so it won't be too sweet. I reduced the amount of soy sauce, to less than half. And I add a lot of spring onions! It's really an excellent food! 
And I love this Allrecipes website! It features a lot of recipes from different countries and flavours! And most are wonderful! This is my favorite cooking site! Thank you!

Easy and tasty. I love fried foods though I’m not a fan of preparing them because of the mess. This was easy and good enough though to ignore the mess (until cleanup time) and enjoy the preparation, presentation and satiation!
Delicious! Didn’t change anything in the recipe or directions—yummy!!

This was delicious, the only changes I made was reducing the brown sugar and adding stir fries vegetables to the skillet after I removed the beef and sauce. Served with rice and sprinkled sesame seeds on top with the green onions.
Was average. I used moose tenderloin. I added one each of red, yellow and orange pepper strips. Served with jasmine rice.
Made a few changes. Stir fried some Thai noodles in with the beef and sauce, didn't clear the pan of oil before. Came out a little sweeter than i'd like but still not bad overall.

Tastes great. Even my kids (who love to ridicule my cooking) liked it. Some refinements I suggest: (1) use less brown sugar and maybe even offset the sweetness by adding a little more garlic; (2) cut the green onions into 1 to 1 1/4 inch pieces; (3) add 1 can of bamboo shoots , sautéed with the beef before adding the sauce; (4) add 1/4 to 1/2 tsp of orange zest to the beef and fry with the beef before adding the sauce. For vegetarians: Substitute firm cubed tofu for beef and you will need to add vegetables, such as broccolini or asparagus.
It was a great and easy recipe. The only thing I would do differently is to cut the brown sugar down. Otherwise I will definitely make this again.

This was Great! I had to tweak it just because I didn't have ginger root on hand so I used a shake or 2 of powdered ginger and only had light brown sugar to use. But made as is otherwise. Perfect recipe. Will definitely make this again.
Needs the sugar cut in half for my taste.

Very yummy! Like others, I have also varied the ingredients, using what I had on hand. I used extra virgin olive oil to make the sauce, instead of vegetable or canola oil. I also used 1/4 cup of the brown sugar. I used half low sodium and half regular soy sauce, to cut the salt. I also used unsalted beef stock instead of water, to boost the beefy flavor. I added a small squeeze of Korean gochujang paste to add a touch of heat, and some unseasoned rice vinegar to cut the sweetness in the sauce. The beef I used was already cooked, so I coated it with cornstarch and added it to the sauce, cooking it until the meat was heated through and the sauce was thick. I did not add the spring onions, as the beef I used already had onions in it.
We love this dish and I have made it many times.
This dish is delicious as printed. I've made it several times, experimenting with shredded cabbage, peanuts or chili garlic sauce (my favorite).
Really sweet. Lots of sugar.
This was amazing!!! My husband and I loved it. I made it just like the recipe said. Next time I will double it so we have more leftovers.
The only change I made was to add some red pepper flakes for some heat. Fantastic recipe.
Excellent recipe!
A little bit salty, would use low sodium soy sauce next time. Added broccoli for some additional veggies. Was very good and a make again.
Turned out yummy! Thanks!
This was a fantastic recipe as written. My family loved it! Thank you for sharing!
After cooking the beef I stirfried 2 Szechuan peppers (broken up) for 30 sec, then green beans and red bell peppers for a few minutes. Very tasty. For more spice I might try 3 peppers next time.
This was SO good. A couple of suggestions: use only 1/4 of the recommended sugar as it’s would be too sweet. I cook broccoli on th side and mix it itnmm
yummy!! two teen boys are it up and asked me to make it again. super easy and simple for a weeknight meal. :) I did use half the sugar as some reviewers commented and it was perfect for us.
Better than going out for dinner!
Didn’t have fresh ginger so I used ground & had stew meat. Wonderful. My husband said make it again! WOW!

Excellent and easy to follow recipe. I followed advice and reduced brown sugar to 1/2C, loosely packed. I also added 2 tablespoons of dark soy sauce in addition to the regular soy sauce. That gave it the depth that some people said was missing.
We loved this recipe. Took off one star only because frying makes such a mess so not fun to clean up. But it was great. Made exactly per the recipe. Will make again!
We love this recipe! We make it with one bunch of green onions and add in about 1/4 tsp of ghost pepper hot sauce and it’s perfect!
Great recipe. Not too difficult, good flavors. Added 2 Tbl rice vinegar to counter act the sweetness

I usually make my own stir fry seasoning and ect. I saw this recipe and decided to try it. Boy am I glad I did. The only thing I changed was I added broccoli cauliflower and a whole onion. This was delicious! The whole family gobbled it up. I for a change served this over rice noodles instead of rice. Will definitely be making this recipe again. Thank you.
Delicious but I think adding a touch of pepper or additional seasoning would have been a great addition! So good!
Delicious and easy to make. I'm so happy to have a quick recipe during a busy week.

Added red, yellow, orange peppers for added color and texture. Next time will add shredded carrots and snow peas. Without any of these vegetables, this is a stand-alone yummy meal! Served with veggie 'fried' rice and steamed broccoli.
Flavor was amazing and I got great reviews from everyone. Be careful when cooking the meat though some of my batches came out a little leather with the recommended time and temp.

Really sweet, needs heat like a couple of dried red peppers for balance. Also you need to add cornstarch to the sauce because the sauce did not thicken. There is no reason to deep fry the meat you can cook it in a pan with a little bit of oil. It doesn’t call for seasoning of the meat but I found that it does need some salt and pepper.While eating it, it was missing a crunch so maybe add an unsalted peanut or carrot or something to give it texture. Add vegetables like red peppers mushrooms etc. for a more balanced meal.If cooked as is, you have runny sweet sauce with tasteless meat.

It was really really good-and simple! It seemed a little too sweet at first, but as I ate it became more savory. I used top round and it was great. The fresh garlic I had at home had turned, so I used garlic powder- may be why it was a little sweet. It’s definitely in the rotation now!

Love it. We used sirloin steak then tenderize it. We threw it on the bbq just for a few to char a little then coated it with corn startch then followed recipe. I added a little bit more ginger red pepper flakes and white along with the green onion

This was a very flavorful dish and one I will be making again. It was a little salty for my tastes so next time I will cut a small amount of soy sauce out and play with other flavors and see how it comes out.

The marinade gave the beef great flavor. It was delicious. However, I would not make it again, as I found it to be labor-intensive for a stir-fry. Slicing the meat first for the marinade, cooking it in batches, draining the meat...It's all the "right" way, but for me, this goes in the "order it in a restaurant" category. Too much work. But great flavor!

This dish is one of my absolute favorite dishes to make! It is so easy and relatively fast. The only tip that I would give someone while making this make sure that the oil in your pan isn’t too hot, or it will splatter everywhere (including you) and can really burn if it splatters on you.?

It was very good and hubby loved it, but time consuming prep will keep it out of regular rotation. Admittedly, cutting/slicing/stirfrying broccoli, red peppers and mushrooms separately added much to the prep, but I don't think hubs would have liked it as much without them.
Yum
No changes made. Turned out great!
This was really good! I didn’t follow directions exactly... I felt there were too many steps... also didn’t use a cup of oil (thought that was too much) it was very tasty! And easy

This was a good recipe. I took others’ advice and lowered the amount of brown sugar to half. If I make this again, I will use low sodium soy sauce. I felt it was a little too salty. Easy dish to make.
Very good
Excellent!
I did step 2 first, makes more sense to do so while making the sauce, helps cut the time down as a whole.
Next time I will add a little more ginger for a little stronger taste of it.
